column4: i installed the .deb of unrar-free , but where do i find it ?????????????????//
you are looking for how to use it, not where it is
do man unrar-free it will tell you
I have unrar, the non free version, else I would install and see
do unrar-free --help, should be some condensed help that will be more usable
nonfree means that it is not open source, it doesn't mean you have to pay
you have unrar, the non free version, and unrar-free the free version

close synaptic, open the terminal (applications>accessories>terminal) and copy and paste this entire thing at once: sudo sed -e 's/# deb/deb/g' -e 's/edgy universe/edgy universe multiverse/g' -e 's/edgy-security universe/edgy-security universe multiverse/g' -i.backup /etc/apt/sources.list && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install unrar
it is enabling the extra repos, unrar is not in the main ones that are enabled by default being nonfree and all
now you should be able to right click on a rar file and just choose extract here, if you want to do it command line, you will need to do rar e whatever.rar
set up a !chroot and install a 32 bit firefox and the plugins
you need to install its dependency
